head-referee.role: One Referee will be designated the Head Referee. The Head Referee is the ultimate authority of the game.

pack-referee.role: Pack referees are responsible for watching the skaters in the pack, assessing pack definition, and calling penalties. They are located both inside and outside the track.

jammer-referee.role: A jammer referee watches the jammer of a designated team, awards points scored by their jammer,[1]: 36  signals whether their jammer has achieved lead jammer status,[17]: 29  and signals the end of the jam if their jammer is lead and calls off the jam.

scorekeepers.role: Record points scored by jammers, as indicated by the Jammer Referees.

penalty-trackers.role: Record each skater's penalties[1]: 36  and notify the head referee of skaters in the current jam who are in danger of fouling out.

penalty-box-manager.role: The penalty box manager can call penalties for penalty box violations or illegal procedures.  The manager points where players are assigned to sit, times the jammers

penalty-box-timer.role: Ensure skaters sent to the penalty box serve their entire penalties.

jam-timer.role: Start jams, signal when a jam runs to the full two minutes, time the 30 seconds between jams, and call official timeouts.

lineup-tracker.role: Record the role (Jammer, Pivot, or Blocker) of every player on the track in each jam.

scoreboard-operator.role: Update the scoreboard after every scoring pass
